'''Geoff Bascand''' is the Deputy Governor and Head of Operations at the [[Reserve Bank of New Zealand]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rbnz.govt.nz/about_us/management_and_board/5273648.html|title=Geoff Bascand (Reserve Bank of New Zealand website)|accessdate=4 June 2013}}</ref><ref name="Stats">{{cite web|url=http://www.stats.govt.nz/tools_and_services/services/media-centre/additional-releases/govt-statistician-reserve-bank.aspx |title=Government Statistician moves to Reserve Bank 
 |accessdate=12 Feb 2013}}</ref> He was Government Statistician and the Chief Executive of [[Statistics New Zealand]] until May 2013.<ref name=GS>[http://www.ssc.govt.nz/appt-ce-stats-may07 ''"Appointment of Chief Executive and Government Statistician for Statistics New Zealand"''], Media Statement, 21 May 2007, State Services Commission, retrieved on 8 June 2007.</ref> Bascand is a graduate of the [[University of Otago]] and the [[Australian National University]] with a BA (Honours) degree in Geography and a master's degree in Economics.<ref name="GS"/>

==Career==
Bascand has worked for the [[New Zealand Treasury]], the [[International Monetary Fund]] in [[Washington, D.C.|Washington]], and the [[New Zealand Department of Labour]]. He was appointed one of three Deputy Government Statisticians for Statistics New Zealand in July 2004 and was responsible for Macro-Economic, Environment, Regional and Geography Statistics. He was appointed Government Statistician and Chief Executive of Statistics New Zealand on May 22, 2007.<ref name="GS"/>
He started his career in 1981 at the Treasury as an economic analyst and later became Director of Forecasting. From 1998 until 2004, Bascand was the General Manager of the Labour Market Policy Group at the Department of Labour. As well as holding senior policy and management positions at the Treasury and the Department of Labour, Bascand has been a Research Fellow at the Centre of Policy Studies at Monash University in Australia, and from 1996 until 1997 he was a staff economist at the International Monetary Fund in Washington DC.<ref>
[http://www2.stats.govt.nz/domino/external/pasfull/pasfull.nsf/00c9e0a06fee31764c2568470008f782/4c2567ef00247c6acc256ec4000141fc?OpenDocument ''"Strategic Leaders Recruited"''], Statistics New Zealand media release, 2 July 2004, retrieved 10 June 2007.</ref> In February 2005, he was a recipient of a Leadership Development Centre Fellowship award.<ref>[http://www.beehive.govt.nz/ViewDocument.aspx?DocumentID=22219 ''"Fellowship winners in public service announced"''], New Zealand Government announcement, 16 February 2005, retrieved 10 June 2007.</ref> On 12 February 2013 Bascand announced his resignation at Statistics New Zealand, finishing there on May 24, 2013. He has accepted a position at the [[Reserve Bank of New Zealand|Reserve Bank]] as Deputy Governor and Head of Operations.<ref name ="Stats" />
